Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: Fantastic Mr. Fox
Description: A clever fox tries to outwit three beastly farmers.
Author: Roald Dahl

Title: Educated
Description: In this acclaimed memoir, Tara Westover recounts growing up in the remote mountains of Idaho with her survivalist parents.
Author: Tara Westover

Title: GRE Verbal Reasoning
Subtitle: Vocabulary Resources to Help You Ace the Test
Description: The GRE Verbal Reasoning Test will test your vocabulary in a variety of different ways. Multiple choice questions will check your understanding of reading comprehension passages. On text completion questions, you will need to identify individual words that best fit in a sentence. On sentence equivalence questions, you will be asked to select two words that have essentially the same meaning and that best complete a sentence. We've collected some of the words that appear most commonly on the GRE Verbal Reasoning Test. Master these words to ensure that you do your best on test day.

Title: Pax
Description: After a war breaks out, Peter is forced to abandon Pax, his beloved pet fox — but Peter and Pax are determined to find one another again.
Author: Sara Pennypacker

Title: The Road to Memphis
Description: As World War II looms, seventeen-year-old Cassie Logan and her brothers experience the trials and tribulations of growing up and face shocking racial violence.
Author: Mildred D. Taylor

Title: The Maze Runner
Description: Thomas wakes up in a strange place with his memories erased, surrounded by people he doesn't know. The only way out is through a shifting, kaleidoscopic maze—and no one has ever reached the end.
Author: James Dashner

Title: Like Vanessa
Description: Inspired by the first black woman to be crowned Miss America, thirteen-year-old Vanessa enters a local beauty pageant in the hopes of transforming her life.
Author: Tami Charles

Title: The Poet X
Description: Xiomara hides her poetry from her religious family, but when she joins a slam poetry club, she must decide whether or not she's ready for her voice to be heard. Learn these words from the acclaimed novel-in-verse by slam poet Elizabeth Acevedo.
Author: Elizabeth Acevedo

Title: The Borrowers

Title: Seabiscuit
Description: In this engrossing work of nonfiction, Laura Hillenbrand recounts how three men teamed up to turn an unlikely racehorse into an American racing icon.
Author: Laura Hillenbrand

Title: Writing in the Classroom: Introductory
Description: Have you got the write stuff? Find out by exploring this comprehensive collection of words related to writing. You'll review genres of writing, text structure, grammar and parts of speech, stages of the writing process, and much more. From introduction to conclusion, this list has got you covered.

Title: A Wreath for Emmett Till

Title: Thirteen Doorways, Wolves Behind Them All

Author: Laura Ruby

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Description: In J.D. Salinger's classic novel, Holden Caulfield leaves his prep school and experiences disillusionment and alienation while wandering around New York City.

Title: Heidi
Description: In this classic novel, an orphaned girl goes to live with her grandfather in the Swiss Alps. Learn these words from the translation by Elisabeth P. Stork.

Title: Shipwreck at the Bottom of the World

Title: Here's Looking at Euclid
Description: To illustrate his thesis that math is the foundation of human progress, Alex Bellos details achievements throughout time and cultures.
Author: Alex Bellos

Title: Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea
Description: Board the Nautilus and travel under the sea with the mysterious Captain Nemo as you learn these words from the science fiction novel by Jules Verne. Read the full text, translated from the original French by F.P. Walter, here.

Author: Pam Muñoz Ryan

Title: A Bounty of November Resources
Subtitle: Feast on This Cornucopia of Lists
Description: Gobble up this autumnal assortment of lists for November’s holidays and special events, including Native American Heritage Month, National Aviation Month, Thanksgiving, Election Day, Veterans Day, and even National Pickle Day.

Title: Kristy's Great Idea
Description: In this first book of The Baby-Sitters Club series, twelve-year-old Kristin Amanda Thomas comes up with the idea to team up with other baby-sitters to advertise and make appointments for individual services in their small Connecticut town.
Author: Ann M. Martin

Title: Frankenstein
Description: In this groundbreaking novel, Dr. Victor Frankenstein works feverishly to bring an inanimate creature to life — but when he finally succeeds, he is horrified by what he has unleashed. Read the full text here.
Author: Mary Shelley

Title: Education and Academics
Description: Studying words related to education and academics not only enhances your language proficiency but also proves invaluable in preparing for the IELTS exam. This collection of vocabulary can help you effectively respond to various academic topics, enabling you to excel in the reading and listening sections of the test. Moreover, utilizing precise academic language in the writing and speaking sections demonstrates your command over formal expressions, further boosting your overall IELTS performance.

Title: Fahrenheit 451
Description: In Fahrenheit 451, Ray Bradbury imagines a dystopian future in which firemen burn banned books and people are constantly bombarded with mindless entertainment. This classic novel is as powerful and relevant today as it was when it was first published in 1953.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Title: The Sky at Our Feet
Description: Believing that his mother has been deported to Afghanistan, twelve-year-old Jason runs away to New York City, where he meets Max, a mischievous girl with epilepsy.
Author: Nadia Hashimi

Title: Same Sun Here
Description: Meena and River, twelve-year-olds from very different backgrounds, become pen pals.
Author: Silas House

Title: My Side of the Mountain
Description: Crowded by his parents and eight siblings in a New York City apartment, twelve-year-old Sam Gribley runs away to live by himself on his great-grandfather's abandoned farm in the Catskill Mountains.
Author: Jean Craighead George

Title: What If It's Us
Description: Arthur and Ben couldn't be more different. Arthur, a Jewish teenager from Georgia, is in New York City for a summer internship that he hopes will help him get into an Ivy League college. Ben, a native New Yorker of Puerto Rican descent, is attending summer school so that he can avoid repeating 11th grade. Find out what happens when a series of coincidences brings these two together.
Author: Becky Albertalli

Title: Circumference
Subtitle: Eratosthenes and the Ancient Quest to Measure the Globe
Description: This nonfiction book recounts the story of how a 245 BCE sea journey from Athens to Alexandria inspired Eratosthenes of Cyrene to contemplate the stars and measure the distance around the earth.
Author: Nicholas Nicastro

Title: For Black Girls Like Me
Description: A cross-country move, questions about her adoption and origins, and an incident of racism at school all have Makeda wondering where she belongs.
Author: Mariama J. Lockington

Title: Gone to the Woods
Subtitle: Surviving a Lost Childhood
Description: In this memoir, Gary Paulsen explores his difficult childhood and details the experiences that led him to write the acclaimed novel Hatchet and its sequels.
Author: Gary Paulsen

Title: Crispin: The Cross of Lead
Description: After being accused of theft, orphan Crispin is on the run in medieval England. As he crosses the country and evades his enemies, he discovers a startling secret about his true identity.
Author: Avi

Title: Breakout
Description: Seventeen-year-old Audelia Thigpen decides to drive away from her Los Angeles foster home, but gets stuck in a traffic jam, which gives her time to reflect on her own and others' lives.
Author: Paul Fleischman

Title: By the Great Horn Spoon!
Description: During the Gold Rush, twelve-year-old Jack journeys to California in hopes of striking it rich.
Author: Sid Fleischman

Title: Carry On, Mr. Bowditch
Description: This novel is a fictionalized biography of Nathaniel Bowditch, a mathematical genius who begins work as an indentured servant on a ship before becoming a captain and celebrated navigator.
Author: Jean Lee Latham

Title: Americanah
Description: This novel tells the story of Ifemelu and Obinze, Nigerians who immigrate to the United States and London, respectively, and eventually reunite in their homeland.
Author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie

Title: You're Not Supposed to Die Tonight
Description: At an upstate New York terror-simulation experience based on events from the slasher film The Curse of Camp Mirror Lake, seventeen-year-old Charity is supposed to be the final girl who survives.
Author: Kalynn Bayron

Title: Words to Describe Art and Literature
Description: Looking for the perfect word to describe a blockbuster movie, a favorite novel, or a museum's latest exhibit? This collection of artsy adjectives will help you paint pictures with words!

Title: Rules
Description: To help her younger brother make sense of life in Maine (and avoid embarrassment), twelve-year-old Catherine writes down a list of rules.
Author: Cynthia Lord

Title: Beowulf
Description: Nobel Prize-winning poet Seamus Heaney translates the Old English epic poem about a warrior's battles with a series of monsters.
Author: Seamus Heaney

Title: Dress Coded
Description: Eighth-grader Molly is fed up with her school's unfair dress code policy, so she starts a podcast to protest it, sparking a rebellion.
Author: Carrie Firestone

Title: One Half from the East
Description: The youngest of four daughters, ten-year-old Obayda must pretend to be a boy to help her family in Afghanistan.
Author: Nadia Hashimi

Title: Candide
Description: In this satirical French novella, a wide-eyed optimist gradually becomes disillusioned. Learn these words from the Modern Library translation. Read the full text here.
Author: Voltaire

Title: Purple Hibiscus
Description: Kambili and Jaja's life among the elite in Nigeria isn't so easy under the thumb of their oppressive father. When the country becomes mired in political turmoil, they are sent to stay with their aunt, where they learn a different way of life.
Author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie

Title: The Chosen
Description: In the 1940s, two Jewish teenagers from different backgrounds develop a deep friendship as they pursue their ambitions.
Author: Chaim Potok

Title: Sugar
Description: Ten-year-old Sugar endures grueling work on a sugar plantation, but her friendships with the plantation owner's son and new Chinese laborers offer her hope and community.
Author: Jewell Parker Rhodes

Title: Founding Brothers
Subtitle: The Revolutionary Generation
Description: This nonfiction account explores the lives and ideas of six "Founding Fathers" of the United States: George Washington, Alexander Hamilton, Thomas Jefferson, Benjamin Franklin, John Adams, and James Madison.
Author: Joseph J. Ellis

Title: Dicey's Song
Subtitle: The Tillerman Cycle, Book 2
Description: Dicey and her siblings adjust to life on their grandmother's farm.
Author: Cynthia Voigt

Title: Foreign Words and Phrases Used in English
Description: You've got carte blanche to learn these foreign words and phrases that commonly appear in English speech and writing. Whether you want to add gravitas to your writing or simply to avoid making a faux pas, mastering these words will help you become a bona fide vocabulary star!

Title: Watched
Description: After a minor run-in with the police, eighteen-year-old Naeem is offered a terrible choice: go to court or spy on members of his community.
Author: Marina Budhos

Title: Fallen Angels
Description: After finishing high school, aspiring writer Richard Perry does not have the money for college, so he decides to enlist in the army and ends up fighting for his life in Vietnam.
Author: Walter Dean Myers

Title: The Remains of the Day
Description: This novel by Nobel laureate Kazuo Ishiguro explores the interior life of a traditional English butler.
Author: Kazuo Ishiguro

Title: A Place to Belong
Description: Like many Japanese-Americans, Hanako and her family are imprisoned in an American internment camp during World War II. After the war ends, they emigrate to Japan — but they struggle to make a home in a country that is unfamiliar to them.
Author: Cynthia Kadohata

Title: If You Come Softly
Description: Two teenagers, both of whom feel like outsiders at their prep school, form a close bond.
Author: Jacqueline Woodson

Title: Zachary Ying and the Dragon Emperor
Description: Possessed by the two-thousand-year-old spirit of the First Emperor Ying Zheng, twelve-year-old Zack must travel from Maine to China to save both his mom and the mortal realm.
Author: Xiran Jay Zhao

Title: Nine, Ten
Subtitle: A September 11 Story
Description: This novel traces the lives of four middle schoolers before, during, and after September 11, 2001.
Author: Nora Raleigh Baskin

Title: The House of the Scorpion
Description: This award-winning dystopian novel tells the story of Matt Alacrán, clone and captive of a powerful feudal lord. Follow Matt as he tries to escape the sinister forces at work in the country of Opium.
Author: Nancy Farmer

Title: The Ear, the Eye and the Arm
Description: In the year 2194, three daring children are on the run in Zimbabwe—but three detectives are hot on their trail.
Author: Nancy Farmer

Title: A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man
Description: In this modernist classic, Stephen Dedalus develops into an artist and challenges the traditional Irish values with which he grew up. Read the full text here.
Author: James Joyce

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: April 2021
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: Language of the Test
Subtitle: Learn to Speak "SAT"
Description: Language of the Test words are academic vocabulary terms that frequently appear in SAT "test talk." They are not the words that may appear in the reading passages; they are the words that show up everywhere else. In fact, we just used a Language of the Test word in the previous sentence. Find it? If you guessed passage, you're right. You can't do well on the SAT if you don't fully understand the academic language being used in the test directions, in the questions, and in the answer options.

Title: Dragon Hoops
Description: In this nonfiction narrative, told in graphic form, Gene Luen Yang follows the Bishop O'Dowd High School basketball team during one eventful season and reflects on his own work as a storyteller.
Author: Gene Luen Yang

Title: The Science of Breakable Things
Description: A seventh-grader's interest in science helps her come to terms with her mother's depression.
Author: Tae Keller

Title: Brain on Fire
Subtitle: My Month of Madness
Description: In this memoir, journalist Susannah Cahalan recounts her battle with a mysterious and terrifying neurological illness at the age of 24.
Author: Susannah Cahalan

Title: Silent to the Bone
Description: Connor's best friend Branwell hasn't said a word since he was accused of seriously injuring his younger sister. Connor is determined to find out what really happened so that Branwell can clear his name.
Author: E.L. Konigsburg

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: June 2020
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Words Used in the News
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: Fourth Grade Rats
Description: In this sequel to Third Grade Angels, Suds Morton tries to take his first steps to becoming a man by acting tough and mean.
Author: Jerry Spinelli

Title: I'll Give You the Sun
Description: Jude and Noah are talented, artistic, impassioned teenagers—and fraternal twins. In this novel, they take turns telling the story of how their family falls apart—and comes together again.
Author: Jandy Nelson

Title: Booked
Description: Kwame Alexander scores again with this story about the soccer-playing son of a linguistics professor. This list of words can assist your goal of improving your vocabulary.
Author: Kwame Alexander

Title: Genuine Fraud
Description: This suspenseful novel, told in reverse chronological order, follows Jule West Williams, a scrappy and resourceful orphan who develops an intense friendship with Imogen, a privileged heiress.
Author: E. Lockhart

Title: The Henna Wars
Description: Set in Dublin, Ireland, Nishat and her childhood friend Flávia contend one another in a high school contest to create the best henna business.
Author: Adiba Jaigirdar

Title: A Room with a View
Description: In the early 20th century, a young Englishwoman travels through Italy. Read the full text here.
Author: E.M. Forster

Title: The Weight of Our Sky
Description: Sixteen-year-old Melati must brave a riot and grapple with her obsessive-compulsive disorder as she attempts to reunite with her mother in 1969 Malaysia.
Author: Hanna Alkaf

Title: When We Were Infinite
Description: Beth, Sunny, Grace, and Brandon make a vow to protect their friend Jason, but tensions strain their relationships with one another.
Author: Kelly Loy Gilbert

Title: One May At A Time: An Efflorescence of Vocabulary
Subtitle: Explore These Lists From the May Calendar
Description: Put some spring in your lingo with this freshly picked collection of lists from the May calendar. This month boasts some wonderfully vocab-rich occasions, from Mother’s Day to Cinco de Mayo to every Star Wars fan’s favorite holiday — May the 4th. There’s even Pack Rat Day, so if you’re a collector of words you’ll have plenty to add to your lexicon.

Title: A World of Color
Description: When it comes to assembling a collection of vocabulary color words, why settle for bland names when you can infuse it with a burst of creativity? These fun names for your colorful lexicon not only add an element of playfulness but also make the process of learning and exploring the nuances of colors all the more enjoyable.

Title: When My Name Was Keoko
Description: This historical novel follows Sun-hee and her brother Tae-yul as their family grapples with political change, prejudice, and war during the Japanese occupation of Korea.
Author: Linda Sue Park

Title: Code Name Verity
Description: Set during World War II, this historical novel tells the story of Julie, a British spy, and Maddie, a pilot. When the friends' plane goes down, Julie must fight to survive in Nazi-occupied France.
Author: Elizabeth Wein

Title: The Prince and the Dressmaker
Description: An inventive seamstress befriends a prince with an eye for unconventional fashion.
Author: Jen Wang

Title: Little Women
Description: Meg, Jo, Beth, and Amy March are sisters whose personalities couldn't be more different. They share joy and heartbreak growing up in the shadow of the Civil War. Read the full text here.
Author: Louisa May Alcott

Title: Arcadia
Description: Set in a British country house, this award-winning play shifts between the early 19th century and the late 20th century and explores science, truth, and the relationship of past and present.
Author: Tom Stoppard

Title: Ophelia
Description: Lisa Klein's adaptation of Shakespeare's Hamlet reimagines the famous tragedy from Ophelia's perspective.
Author: Lisa Klein

Title: Watch Us Rise
Description: Told in alternating perspectives, this novel follows the ups and downs of Jasmine and Chelsea, two girls who start a club to give young women at their school a voice.
Author: Renée Watson

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: May 2021
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: The Invisible Man
Description: In this science fiction novel published in 1897, a brilliant scientist discovers a way to make himself invisible and is corrupted by his newfound powers.
Author: H.G. Wells
